com.android.slackandhay.gameobject
Class GOGameObjectManager

java.lang.Object
  com.android.slackandhay.gameobject.GOGameObjectManager

public class GOGameObjectManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class keeps track of all game objects and updates them after every frame

Author:
Tilman BÃ¶rner, Jan Rabe & Tom Wallroth

private  java.util.Vector<GOGameObject> gameObjects
          all game object manager share the same object vector reference as the renderer

Constructor Summary

          creates a new game object manager
 
Method Summary
 void addGameObject(GOGameObject go)
          adds a game object to the game object list
 void createGameObjects()
          creates all game objects as defined inside the level
 GOGameObject createNewCamera()
          creates a new camera and adds it to the game objects list
 GOGameObject createNewDecoration(Animation animation, Texture texture)
          creates a decoration
 GOGameObject createNewEnemyDog()
          creates a new dog
 GOGameObject createNewEnemySoldier()
          creates a soldier
 GOGameObject createNewPlayer()
          Creates a new Player object and adds it to the game object list, sets the appropriate textures
 GOGameObject createNonGridMember(float x, float y, float width, float height, Texture texture)
          Creates a non-grid member, adds it to the game object list and adds its texture to the graphics component
 java.util.Vector<GOGameObject> getGameObjects()
           
 void recycle(GOGameObject go)
          this method recycles a game object, meaning that dead game objects are collected, so that they can be used again the method also triggers the revival of dead game objects once the number of destroyed objects is greater than the NEXT_ENEMY_WAVE_THROSHOLD by calling resetDestroyedGameObjects
 void recycleStepByStep()
          this method recycles one game object at a time, to balance the CPU load over time
 void removeGameObject(GOGameObject go)
          removes a game object fromthe game object list
private  void resetDestroyedGameObjects()
          revives destroyed game objects and gives them a random free position on the grid
 void update(int dt)
          the update method of the game object manager calls recycleStepByStep after a certain amount of time

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Constructor Detail

GOGameObjectManager

public GOGameObjectManager(GridWorld grid,
                           Level level)
creates a new game object manager

Parameters:
grid - the grid used by the game object manager to insert and move game objects
level - the level used by the game object manager

public void createGameObjects()
creates all game objects as defined inside the level

public GOGameObject createNewPlayer()
Creates a new Player object and adds it to the game object list, sets the appropriate textures

Returns:
the newly created player

creates a new camera and adds it to the game objects list

createNonGridMember

public GOGameObject createNonGridMember(float x,
                                        float y,
                                        float width,
                                        float height,
                                        Texture texture)
Creates a non-grid member, adds it to the game object list and adds its texture to the graphics component

Parameters:
x - the x posistion of the object
y - the y posistion of the object
width - the width of the object
height - the height of the object
texture - the texture of the object
Returns:
the newly created object

addGameObject

public void addGameObject(GOGameObject go)
adds a game object to the game object list

Parameters:
go - the game object to add

removeGameObject

public void removeGameObject(GOGameObject go)
removes a game object fromthe game object list

Parameters:
go - the game object to remove

recycleStepByStep

public void recycleStepByStep()
this method recycles one game object at a time, to balance the CPU load over time

recycle

public void recycle(GOGameObject go)
this method recycles a game object, meaning that dead game objects are collected, so that they can be used again the method also triggers the revival of dead game objects once the number of destroyed objects is greater than the NEXT_ENEMY_WAVE_THROSHOLD by calling resetDestroyedGameObjects

Parameters:
go - the game object you are trying to recycle

resetDestroyedGameObjects

private void resetDestroyedGameObjects()
revives destroyed game objects and gives them a random free position on the grid

update

public void update(int dt)
the update method of the game object manager calls recycleStepByStep after a certain amount of time

Parameters:
dt - the time that has passed in milliseconds

getGameObjects

public java.util.Vector<GOGameObject> getGameObjects()
Returns:
the game object list as vector
